summary: This document appears to be a prison log or observation record from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing periods of psychological observation for inmate H01-001L (Jeffrey Epstein) in July 2019. It includes timestamps for watch changes and observation statuses, and lists a forensic psychologist.

persons.name: H01-001L
persons.context: The primary inmate referenced in the log, identified by their inmate number, who was placed on and removed from psychology observation multiple times in July 2019.

events.title: Staff Watch Begins
events.description: A staff watch on inmate H01-001L began at 1:40 AM.

events.title: Psychology Observation Started
events.description: Inmate H01-001L was placed on psychology observation at 6:00 PM.

events.title: Psychology Observation Ended
events.description: Psychology observation for inmate H01-001L ended at 9:00 AM.

events.title: Inmate Companion Change
events.description: An inmate companion took over watch at 7:00 AM for H01-001L.

events.title: Psychology Observation Restarted
events.description: H01-001L was changed to psychology observation at 8:45 AM.

events.title: Psychology Observation Ended Again
events.description: Psychology observation for H01-001L ended at 8:15 AM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Inmate H01-001L (Jeffrey Epstein) was under psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York during July 2019.
The log shows precise timestamps for the start and end of psychology observation periods and staff watch changes.
The document references a forensic psychologist with the U.S. Public Health Service assigned to the facility.
The observation periods occurred shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating heightened monitoring.
